Sentece: The optimal compound discovered during these studies, 15q (TBC11251), binds competitively to human ETA receptors with a Ki of 0.43 +/- 0.03 nM and an IC50 of 1.4 nM (IC50 for ETB = 9800 nM).
Title: Discovery of TBC11251, a potent, long acting, orally active endothelin receptor-A selective antagonist.
Name: Sitaxentan

Sentece: As a result, TBC3711 (7z) was identified as our second endothelin antagonist to enter the clinic due to its good oral bioavailability (approximately 100%) in rats, high potency (ET(A) IC(50) = 0.08 nM), and optimal ET(A)/ET(B) selectivity (441 000-fold).
